intro: Koanophyllon flavidulum, commonly known as the yellow flaxweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, and the plant produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Koanophyllon flavidulum is a low-growing perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
